Crockpot BBQ Chicken

Jump to Recipe

Looking for a simple yet tantalizing dish that can please the entire family? Look no further than this Crockpot BBQ Chicken recipe! Perfect for busy weeknights or a cozy weekend gathering, this dish requires minimal prep and delivers maximum flavor. With just a handful of ingredients including tender boneless, skinless chicken breasts, zesty BBQ sauce, and aromatic spices, you can create a meal that is both satisfying and delicious. Plus, cooking it in a crockpot means you can set it and forget it, allowing the flavors to meld beautifully while you go about your day. Whether served on a bun, with rice, or alongside your favorite veggies, this BBQ chicken is a versatile dish that is sure to become a staple in your household. Get ready to enjoy a mouthwatering meal with minimal effort!

Ingredients

boneless, skinless chicken breasts

For the best results, choose chicken breasts that are uniform in size to ensure even cooking. You can substitute with boneless, skinless chicken thighs for a richer flavor and moisture. If you want to reduce cooking time, consider cutting the chicken into smaller pieces.

bbq sauce

Select a BBQ sauce that matches your taste preference—sweet, tangy, or smoky. You can make your own by combining ketchup, apple cider vinegar, brown sugar, and spices if you prefer a homemade version. For a healthier option, look for lower-sugar or organic BBQ sauces.

garlic powder

If you prefer fresh garlic, use 2-3 cloves minced instead of garlic powder. To enhance flavor, consider adding a pinch of smoked paprika or cayenne pepper for a spicy kick.

onion powder

Similar to garlic powder, fresh onion can be used instead—about 1/4 cup finely chopped onion should suffice. You can also enhance the flavor by adding diced shallots for a milder taste.

salt

Adjust the amount of salt based on the saltiness of your BBQ sauce. If you're watching your sodium intake, consider using a low-sodium salt or omit it entirely, as the BBQ sauce will provide some saltiness.

pepper

Freshly ground black pepper will provide a more robust flavor than pre-ground pepper. To elevate the dish, consider adding a pinch of crushed red pepper flakes for heat or a blend of peppercorns for complexity.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Chicken

    Start by placing 2 pounds of boneless, skinless chicken breasts into the crockpot. Ensure that the chicken pieces are evenly distributed at the bottom for even cooking.

  • Step 2: Mix the BBQ Sauce

    In a medium-sized bowl, combine 1 cup of your favorite BBQ sauce with 1 teaspoon of garlic powder, 1 teaspoon of onion powder, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of pepper. Stir well until all ingredients are fully incorporated.

  • Step 3: Combine Chicken and Sauce

    Pour the BBQ sauce mixture over the chicken breasts in the crockpot. Make sure the chicken is well coated with the sauce for maximum flavor.

  • Step 4: Cook the Chicken

    Cover the crockpot with its lid. Set it to cook on low for 6 hours or on high for 3 hours. It's best to cook on low if you have the time, as it allows the chicken to become more tender.

  • Step 5: Shred the Chicken

    Once cooked, use two forks to shred the chicken directly in the crockpot. Mix it thoroughly with the BBQ sauce to ensure every piece is flavorful. Serve the shredded BBQ chicken warm.

Frequently Asked Questions

What should I do if I don't have a crockpot?

If you don't have a crockpot, you can use a slow cooker or even a Dutch oven in the oven at a low temperature. Just make sure to adjust the cooking time accordingly.

How do I know when the chicken is fully cooked?

Chicken is fully cooked when it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (75°C). You can use a meat thermometer to check the temperature.

Can I use frozen chicken breasts?

Yes, you can use frozen chicken breasts, but make sure to cook them on high for about 4-5 hours or until they reach the safe cooking temperature.

What can I serve with BBQ chicken?

BBQ chicken goes great with sides like coleslaw, cornbread, or steamed vegetables. You can also serve it on buns for BBQ chicken sandwiches!

How should I store leftovers?

Store leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days. You can also freeze them for longer storage.

Can I add more spices or ingredients?

Absolutely! Feel free to customize the recipe by adding spices like paprika, cayenne pepper for heat, or even diced onions and bell peppers for extra flavor.

What if I don't have BBQ sauce?

If you don’t have BBQ sauce on hand, you can make a simple mixture of ketchup, vinegar, brown sugar, and spices to create a quick homemade BBQ sauce.

Is it safe to leave the crockpot on all day?

Yes, it’s safe to leave the crockpot on low for several hours. Just ensure you follow the recommended cooking times and don’t leave it on for more than 8 hours.

How do I shred the chicken easily?

After the chicken is cooked, use two forks to pull the chicken apart. It should shred easily if it’s cooked properly.

What are some variations of this recipe?

You can try different sauces like teriyaki, honey mustard, or even a spicy chipotle sauce for different flavor profiles!

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

To make this dish gluten-free, ensure that the BBQ sauce used is gluten-free. For a healthier, lower-carb option, serve the chicken wrapped in lettuce leaves instead of on buns. If you want to include a vegetarian version, substitute the chicken with jackfruit cooked in the same BBQ sauce mixture. This dish is naturally dairy-free, making it suitable for lactose-intolerant diners.

Pairings

Serve the Crockpot BBQ Chicken with classic sides such as coleslaw, cornbread, or baked beans. For a refreshing beverage, consider pairing it with a chilled lager, iced tea, or lemonade. If you're looking for a green option, grilled asparagus or a simple garden salad works well too.

Serving Suggestions

For serving, place the shredded BBQ chicken on toasted buns to create delicious sliders. Top with additional BBQ sauce, pickles, and onion rings for added crunch and flavor. For a more substantial meal, serve the chicken over a bed of rice or quinoa, and drizzle with extra sauce. Garnish with fresh chopped parsley for color and added freshness.

#

Crockpot BBQ Chicken

370 min
$10
250 kcal
Difficulty: 10%
Servings: 6

Dietary Tags:

gluten-freedairy-free

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Main Course

Tags:

easycrockpotchickenBBQcomfort food

Description

Tender, juicy chicken smothered in sweet and tangy BBQ sauce, perfect for sandwiches or served with rice!

Ingredients

  • boneless, skinless chicken breasts: 2 pounds
  • bbq sauce: 1 cup
  • garlic powder: 1 teaspoon
  • onion powder: 1 teaspoon
  • salt: 1/2 teaspoon
  • pepper: 1/2 teaspoon
